name: Neural Alpha
slogan: Crunching data to shed light on the financing of tropical deforestation
description: Using cutting edge technology like connected data, graph networks, machine learning, cloud (AWS), data science and our deep knowledge of how financial systems work, we’re combatting climate change by fighting deforestation at its root - the sources of funding. We take data from satellites to spot where deforestation is happening and merge that with company, financial and shipping data from governments and NGOs to reconstruct the whole deforestation supply chain. Who is paying for rainforest in Brazil and Indonesia to be cut down? Who is farming on that new land? Who is shipping the soy or beef from that land around the world? Who is buying it? Essentially – who is funding deforestation? We’re building tools to provide this clarity. Our tools are used by environmental agencies and journalists to uncover the causes of deforestation and by banks and other investment institutions to reduce their exposure to unethical practices.

jobs.title: Full Stack software developer (Node.js)
jobs.description:
We are looking for Full Stack Developers with experience in Data-centric Software Development and a flair for back end as well as front end application development. Neural Alpha is a unique data consultancy & software development company applying innovative Connected Data approaches (graph databases, semantic & related technologies) to Sustainable Investment & other complex requirements within the Financial Services industry.
 
We help NGOs, financial institutions and investors maximise the sustainability credentials of their investments – using these technologies to minimise investments in deforestation, carbon intensive activities & other areas. Our team is based in Kennington and Warsaw (Poland) and we are on the search for developers with a passion for building visually rich and innovative applications which distill the complexity of addressing sustainable investment challenges.
 
Our development stack involves Javascript (React/d3.js) in the front-end, Node and python in the back-end. Our APIs are written in GraphQL and we use a variety of NoSQL databases including document stores such as MongoDB and Elasticsearch and graph databases/triple stores. We are completely cloud-based on AWS using multiple resources such as Cognito, EC2, DynamoDB, S3, etc.
 
The role is a rare and exciting opportunity to join an innovative start-up with a great culture, friendly people and a great location in Edinburgh House workspace offices in Kennington (London).
Ideally a more experienced candidate will have a Computer Science background, demonstrable work experience and portfolio pieces illustrating front & back end programming skills. It is useful, but not essential, to have experience using semantic / linked data technologies, graphql, graph databases, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques.

Preferred skills/qualifications:
Experience at building Node.js applications essential
Educational Background in Computer Science or alternative STEM degree
1+ years commercial experience essential
Experience of deploying Microservices essential
Experience developing on AWS essential
Experience of GraphQL very useful
Experience of modern development standards - TDD, CI/CD very useful

Company Benefits
Fantastic on the job training scheme in core data & development skills
25 days starting holiday
Competitive salary
Brand new macbook for a great development experience
Great office location on Vauxhall / Kennington border – we’re based in a workspace serviced office with breakfasts every Monday, social beers on a Friday, kitchen, bike storage & showers
Eligibility to annual company bonus scheme after 6 months employment.

Interview Process
Initial phone call
Technical exercise
Final interview
